RTCEncodedVideoFrame.summary: The RTCEncodedVideoFrame of the WebRTC API represents an encoded video frame in the WebRTC receiver or sender pipeline, which may be modified using a WebRTC Encoded Transform.

RTCEncodedVideoFrameData.summary: The data property of the interface returns a buffer containing the frame data.

RTCEncodedVideoFrameGetMetadata.summary: The getMetadata() method of the interface returns an object containing the metadata associated with the frame.

remarks.para: This includes information about the frame, including its size, video encoding, other frames needed to construct a full image, timestamp, and other information.

RTCEncodedVideoFrameGetMetadata.returns: An object with the following properties:

RTCEncodedVideoFrameTimestamp.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The timestamp read-only property of the interface indicates the time at which frame sampling started.
RTCEncodedVideoFrameTimestamp.value: A positive integer containing the sampling instant of the first byte in this frame, in microseconds.

RTCEncodedVideoFrameType.summary: The type read-only property of the interface indicates whether this frame is a key frame, delta frame, or empty frame.
RTCEncodedVideoFrameType.value: The type can have one of the following values:
